Row.Text: +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and this unit does not require resources when created or to maintain. (Abraham Lincoln)
Preserver of the Union
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different governments, and really dislikes civilizations with different governments of the same era as its own.
I am Abraham Lincoln, the President of a young nation, but one that builds upon dreams.
What you cannot win by words, you will not win with weapons.
Those who deny others freedom do not themselves deserve it.
Is it not easier to agree, when we both defer to justice.
A House divided against itself cannot stand. We hope you follow our lead in advancing the cause of liberty.
A darkness falls upon me. But never did a darkness not give way to dawn.
We unite, or we perish!
You say you would be a friend to me, but you are an enemy to liberty, which is my soul.
We must unite in friendship, lest we be destroyed in division.
Do we not destroy our enemies when we make them our friends?
We cannot bring into our union what would, in time, tear it apart.
We have shown your delegation around our humble home here. Perhaps I shall escort them also to the theater!
We are a new nation, in a new world. We need not the trappings of the old.
We have delivered to you a roast turkey, mashed potatoes, stuffing and cranberry sauce, in thanks for our meeting.
Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
What shall I say to you, you who wring your bread from the sweat of those whom you oppress? (Denounces You)
Come and share in this new vision of a brave new world, what we have wrought here.
I'm not going to stand in the way of a sensible idea.
Would you see how America extends across the amber waves of grain?
What will it be? I am at your service.
I call you to unity, that the cause of liberty might advance!
Mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
To accept this would be to accept that our soldiers died in vain. This I cannot do.
We would lay down our arms, to have for our people a new birth of freedom, that we might not perish from the earth.
All are free on American soil.
Do we allow the venomous snake into our home? We cannot.
Our people yearn to see new lands and new shores. Will you allow it?
Your envoys say peace, but your troops are armed and massing. What do you expect us to make of this?
I must study the plain facts of the case here, and choose what is wise and right. My answer is no.
We thank you for these gifts - we have always brought in what is best in the world to further strengthen our union.
Kabasa
[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against civilization's whose capital is on a different continent. (Nzinga Mbande)
Decolonization
Likes civilizations on continents where she has no cities. Dislikes civilizations that have a city on her home continent.
Nzinga Mbande is upset you share the same home continent
Nzinga Mbande likes that you have yet to expand to a continent she occupies
Amina
I am queen Nzinga. Please, sit anywhere.
Go ahead, send your soldiers! We will melt into the trees and strike at you from the stones.
We come to set your lands and your flags on fire.
Let us exchange ideas, gold, and good... just not land.
The divine has granted each of us a land to rule as we see fit. Stay in your corner.
Your swords cleave only flesh. Your chains bind only hands. Our souls remain ours.
Where friendship grows, there is generosity.
So many come offering friendships, but in their eyes I see the glitter of greed.
A queen must be fierce to her enemies, but cultivate friendships where we can.
Yes, we can see in your eyes there is no witchcraft there.
We weigh these issues carefully, and cannot accept that which would be a risk.
Your delegation and I discussed much, and I think our nations have much to learn from each other.
Under each of your gifts, there is self-interest.
We have here beans with palm oil, okra and toasted grasshopper. Take a handful of funge de bombo and dip it in the sauce!
You choose hostility instead of compromise. You clearly do not know with whom you deal.
Your wicked customs you bring to us and seek to spread. We cannot allow this. (Denounces You)
These lands are rich and varied, their wonders must be experienced!
I'm glad to reach an agreement.
Shall I tell you of the beauty of the Kongolese lands? Of Ndongo, of Angola?
I stand to receive you.
Unite our lands, that we may let them prosper!
Peace is always preferable to war. Let us have it.
You claim to seek peace, but behind your eyes I see new plans forming. No.
The Imbangala have gone back to hunting antelope, rather than hunting your men.
We have people from the Handa, from the Mucawana, the Mbundu, all in our lands. Why not yours?
With peace and understanding comes trust. We're not there yet.
A wise leader knows who means harm and who does not. Can you tell our peaceful intentions?
Please. I am no stranger to war. I can see where it is being plotted. Prove me wrong.
Please, you think you can buy us off with some baubles? Try better.
Gifts, yes, gifts are appropriate. I accept.
+100% Flanking and Support Bonus. (Saladin (Sultan))
Sultan of Egypt and Syria
Likes civilizations that have founded a Religion but not brought it to one of his cities. Dislikes civilizations that bring him their Religion.
My sword shall stand between you and the holy places of the world. Your touch will not defile them. (You have established a Religion and brought it to Saladin)
Faith means peace, where the strong defend the weak. (You have established a religion but not brought it to Saladin.)
Saladin is disappointed you brought your religion to him
Saladin is delighted your religion is not in his lands
